message.content:
cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SD, cs.CC, cs.CR

This paper is likely to belong to the Social and Information Retrieval (cs.SI) sub-category as it deals with online political discussions and the theory of echo chambers. It may also belong to the Cybersecurity (cs.CY) sub-category as it explores the behavior of individuals in an online white nationalist website. Additionally, it could be categorized under Social Networks and Graph Analysis (cs.SD) as it uses observational trace data to analyze online interactions. The paper also touches upon issues of Computational Complexity (cs.CC) as it discusses the challenges of studying echo chambers at a macro-level. Finally, it may be relevant to the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category as it explores the implications of its findings for policy makers seeking to promote a more moderate political internet.
